briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety in Patients With Primary IgA Nephropathy Who Have Completed Study Nef-301 (Nefigard-OLE)
officialTitle: An Open-Label Extension (OLE) Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Nefecon Treatment in Patients With IgA Nephropathy Who Have Completed Study Nef-301
summary: This is a Phase 3b, multicenter, open-label extension (OLE) study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Nefecon treatment in patients with IgAN who have completed the Phase 3 Study Nef-301 and continue to be treated with a stable dose of RAS inhibitor therapy (ACEIs and/or ARBs). Patients who previously received Nefecon in Study Nef-301 will receive retreatment, whereas patients who previously received placebo in Study Nef-301 will be treatment naïve to Nefecon.

primaryOutcome.measure: Ratio of Urine Protein to Creatine Ratio (UPCR) at 9 Months Compared to Baseline

effectByArm.arm: Retreatment - Previously Treated With Nefecon in Nef-301 Study
Delayed Treatment - Previously Treated With Placebo in Nef-301 Study
